TITLE: Configuring Brevo (SendInBlue) SMTP Settings for Discourse DESCRIPTION: SMTP configuration template for Brevo (formerly SendInBlue) with Discourse. Provides the server address, credential locations, and port settings. Brevo offers 300 emails per day free and is GDPR compliant. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/docs/INSTALL-email.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` SMTP server address? smtp-relay.brevo.com SMTP user name? [SMTP credentials for your domain under [SMTP-Key tab](https://app.brevo.com/settings/keys/smtp)] SMTP password? [SMTP credentials for your domain under [SMTP-Key tab](https://app.brevo.com/settings/keys/smtp)] Port: 587 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Discourse Launcher Command Reference DESCRIPTION: Complete usage guide for the Discourse launcher utility, showing all available commands and options for container management and maintenance SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/docs/INSTALL-cloud.md#2025-04-19_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` Usage: launcher COMMAND CONFIG [--skip-prereqs] [--docker-args STRING] Commands: start: Start/initialize a container stop: Stop a running container restart: Restart a container destroy: Stop and remove a container enter: Use nsenter to get a shell into a container logs: View the Docker logs for a container bootstrap: Bootstrap a container for the config based on a template rebuild: Rebuild a container (destroy old, bootstrap, start new) cleanup: Remove all containers that have stopped for > 24 hours Options: --skip-prereqs Don't check launcher prerequisites --docker-args Extra arguments to pass when running docker ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Launching Discourse Setup Tool in Bash DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Discourse setup tool, which will guide the user through the configuration process. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/docs/INSTALL-cloud.md#2025-04-19_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ./discourse-setup ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Upgrading Discourse via Command Line DESCRIPTION: Command for rebuilding and upgrading a Discourse installation by accessing the server via SSH SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/docs/INSTALL-cloud.md#2025-04-19_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` cd /var/discourse ./launcher rebuild app ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Docker and Git Prerequisites on Debian/Ubuntu DESCRIPTION: Commands to install Docker and Git on a Debian or Ubuntu-based Linux distribution using apt package manager. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/docs/INSTALL-cloud.md#2025-04-19_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo apt install docker.io sudo apt install git ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Discourse Import Script DESCRIPTION: Shell commands for running the import script in both development and production environments using Ruby. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/script/import_scripts/socialcast/README.md#2025-04-19_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` bundle exec ruby import.rb ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Migration-specific Gems DESCRIPTION: Command to update only the gems related to migrations in the Discourse project. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/migrations/README.md#2025-04-19_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` bundle update --group migrations ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring SendGrid SMTP Settings for Discourse DESCRIPTION: SMTP configuration template for SendGrid with Discourse. Provides the server address and credential format, recommending API Key usage instead of username/password. SendGrid offers 40k emails on a 30 day trial. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/docs/INSTALL-email.md#2025-04-19_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` SMTP server address? smtp.sendgrid.net SMTP user name? apikey SMTP password? [SendGrid API Key] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing Cloud Server via SSH in Bash DESCRIPTION: Command to connect to a cloud server using SSH with the root user and server IP address. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/docs/INSTALL-cloud.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ssh root@192.168.1.1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Indented Code Block in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how to create an indented code block by indenting each line with four or more spaces. The content is treated as literal text and not parsed as Markdown. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/spec/fixtures/md/spec.txt#2025-04-19_snippet_62 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` a simple indented code block ``` LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` 
a simple
  indented code block
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring and Installing Migration-specific Gems DESCRIPTION: Commands to configure Bundler to include migrations-specific gems and install them in the Discourse project. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/migrations/README.md#2025-04-19_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` bundle config set --local with migrations bundle install ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Launching Discourse Docker Container with Bootstrap Command DESCRIPTION: This command initializes a Discourse installation using the Docker-based launcher script. It shows the beginning of the Docker image download process and a warning about download time. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/script/benchmarks/markdown/giant_post.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` [discourse]# ./launcher bootstrap app which: no docker.io in (/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/sbin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/root/bin) WARNING: We are about to start downloading the Discourse base image This process may take anywhere between a few minutes to an hour, depending on your network speed Please be patient Unable to find image 'samsaffron/discourse:1.0.13' locally 1.0.13: Pulling from samsaffron/discourse ........ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Production Import Script DESCRIPTION: Shell command for running the import script specifically in a production environment. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/script/import_scripts/socialcast/README.md#2025-04-19_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` RAILS_ENV=production bundle exec ruby import.rb ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Mailgun SMTP Settings for Discourse DESCRIPTION: SMTP configuration template for Mailgun with Discourse. Provides the server address and information on where to find credentials. Mailgun offers 50k emails/month on a 30 day trial or 10k emails/month with no trial. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/docs/INSTALL-email.md#2025-04-19_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` SMTP server address? smtp.mailgun.org SMTP user name? [SMTP credentials for your domain under domains tab] SMTP password? [SMTP credentials for your domain under domains tab] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Elastic Email SMTP Settings for Discourse DESCRIPTION: SMTP configuration template for Elastic Email with Discourse. Provides the server address, credential format, and port settings. Includes a note about working with Elastic Email to disable their default unsubscribe link. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/docs/INSTALL-email.md#2025-04-19_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` SMTP server address? smtp.elasticemail.com SMTP user name? [Your registered email address] SMTP password? [Elastic Email API Key] SMTP port? 2525 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Quandora Import Script DESCRIPTION: Shell command to run the Ruby import script which loads the exported JSON data into Discourse. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/script/import_scripts/quandora/README.md#2025-04-19_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` ruby import.rb ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Cloning Discourse Docker Repository in Bash DESCRIPTION: Commands to clone the official Discourse Docker image repository into the /var/discourse directory, change to that directory, and set appropriate permissions. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/docs/INSTALL-cloud.md#2025-04-19_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo -s git clone https://github.com/discourse/discourse_docker.git /var/discourse cd /var/discourse chmod 700 containers ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Composer Upload Handler in Discourse DESCRIPTION: Modified to handle multiple files at once, grouped based on how they were added. Files are sent in batches to matching handlers, improving efficiency for bulk uploads. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/docs/CHANGELOG-JAVASCRIPT-PLUGIN-API.md#2025-04-19_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` addComposerUploadHandler ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Inline Link in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Example of a simple inline link with text, URI, and title. The example shows the Markdown input and resulting HTML output. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/spec/fixtures/md/spec.txt#2025-04-19_snippet_228 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` [link](/uri "title") ``` LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```

link

``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Details Tags in Discourse Posts DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the [details] tag in Discourse posts to create expandable content sections. The example shows how to wrap text with a summary and hidden details. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/plugins/discourse-details/README.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` I watched the murder mystery on TV last night. [details=Who did it?]The butler did it[/details]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Referencing Server-Side Sanitizer in Discourse DESCRIPTION: This reference points to the server-side sanitizer implementation in Discourse that uses the Sanitize gem to prevent XSS attacks. The code is located in the pretty_text.rb file in the lib directory. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/docs/SECURITY.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/lib/pretty_text.rb ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Registering Custom HighlightJS Plugin in Discourse DESCRIPTION: Adds the ability to register custom HighlightJS plugins in Discourse. This function allows users to extend syntax highlighting capabilities. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/docs/CHANGELOG-JAVASCRIPT-PLUGIN-API.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` registerHighlightJSPlugin ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Multiple Poster Icons in Discourse DESCRIPTION: Enables adding multiple icons to a poster. This function replaces and extends the functionality of the existing addPosterIcon, allowing for conditional icon addition based on attributes. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/docs/CHANGELOG-JAVASCRIPT-PLUGIN-API.md#2025-04-19_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` addPosterIcons ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Markdown Link with Inline Formatting DESCRIPTION: Example of a link containing inline formatting elements (emphasis, strong, and code) within the link text. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/spec/fixtures/md/spec.txt#2025-04-19_snippet_259 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` [link *foo **bar** `#`*](/uri) ``` LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```

link foo bar #

``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Migration-specific Tests DESCRIPTION: Command to run RSpec tests specific to migrations, using a custom path configuration to target the migrations test directory. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/migrations/README.md#2025-04-19_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` bin/rspec --default-path migrations/spec ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Comparing AsciiDoc and Markdown Syntax DESCRIPTION: Two code examples comparing AsciiDoc and Markdown syntax for creating nested lists with indented blocks. The examples demonstrate how Markdown's readability advantage stems from its visual representation of structure. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/spec/fixtures/md/spec.txt#2025-04-19_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` 1. List item one. + List item one continued with a second paragraph followed by an Indented block. + ................. $ ls *.sh $ mv *.sh ~/tmp ................. + List item continued with a third paragraph. 2. List item two continued with an open block. + -- This paragraph is part of the preceding list item. a. This list is nested and does not require explicit item continuation. + This paragraph is part of the preceding list item. b. List item b. This paragraph belongs to item two of the outer list. -- ``` LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` 1. List item one. List item one continued with a second paragraph followed by an Indented block. $ ls *.sh $ mv *.sh ~/tmp List item continued with a third paragraph. 2. List item two continued with an open block. This paragraph is part of the preceding list item. 1. This list is nested and does not require explicit item continuation. This paragraph is part of the preceding list item. 2. List item b. This paragraph belongs to item two of the outer list. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Mailjet SMTP Settings for Discourse DESCRIPTION: SMTP configuration template for Mailjet with Discourse. Provides information on where to find the server address and credentials. Mailjet offers 6k emails/month with a maximum of 200 per day. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/docs/INSTALL-email.md#2025-04-19_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` SMTP server address? [Mailjet SMTP server address] SMTP username? [Mailjet API key] SMTP password? [Mailjet secret key] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deployment Configuration Commands DESCRIPTION: Series of shell commands for setting up directories, symlinks, and permissions for a Discourse installation SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/script/benchmarks/markdown/giant_post.md#2025-04-19_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` cd /var/www/discourse && mkdir -p tmp/pids cd /var/www/discourse && mkdir -p tmp/sockets cd /var/www/discourse && touch tmp/.gitkeep cd /var/www/discourse && mkdir -p /shared/log/rails ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Socialcast API Credentials in YAML DESCRIPTION: Configuration file template containing Socialcast instance credentials for API access. Requires domain name, username, and password. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/script/import_scripts/socialcast/README.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` domain: 'my-socialcast-domain' username: 'my-socialcast-username' password: 'my-socialcast-password' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: CSS for Preserving Whitespace in Code Spans DESCRIPTION: Recommended CSS to preserve whitespace in rendered code spans, as browsers typically collapse consecutive spaces. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/spec/fixtures/md/spec.txt#2025-04-19_snippet_160 LANGUAGE: css CODE: ``` code{white-space: pre-wrap;} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: List Item Indented One Space Example in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates a list item with one space indentation containing a paragraph, code block, and blockquote. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/spec/fixtures/md/spec.txt#2025-04-19_snippet_107 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` 1. A paragraph with two lines. indented code > A block quote. ``` LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```

  1. A paragraph with two lines.

    indented code

    A block quote.

``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: SQLite Multi-process Write Performance Comparison DESCRIPTION: Benchmark comparing single-writer vs multi-process writing strategies for SQLite. Shows that using multiple processes with separate database files is dramatically faster than either single-writer or forked processes writing to the same database. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/migrations/scripts/benchmarks/RESULTS.md#2025-04-19_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` single writer 43.9766 seconds forked writer - same DB 53.5112 seconds forked writer - multi DB 3.0815 seconds ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Hash vs Data Class Comparison for Database Inserts in Ruby DESCRIPTION: Benchmark comparing insert speeds when using different data binding methods (regular, hash, Data class) with Extralite and SQLite3. Results show Extralite's regular method is fastest, while Data class with array is a close second. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/migrations/scripts/benchmarks/RESULTS.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` Extralite regular 868.703k (± 2.2%) i/s - 8.744M in 10.070511s Extralite hash 579.753k (± 1.2%) i/s - 5.838M in 10.071266s Extralite data 672.752k (± 0.8%) i/s - 6.790M in 10.093191s Extralite data/array 826.296k (± 0.9%) i/s - 8.318M in 10.067518s SQLite3 regular 362.037k (± 0.7%) i/s - 3.628M in 10.021699s SQLite3 hash 308.647k (± 1.1%) i/s - 3.111M in 10.081159s SQLite3 data/hash 288.747k (± 2.7%) i/s - 2.890M in 10.018335s Comparison: Extralite regular: 868702.8 i/s Extralite data/array: 826295.7 i/s - 1.05x slower Extralite data: 672752.0 i/s - 1.29x slower Extralite hash: 579753.5 i/s - 1.50x slower SQLite3 regular: 362037.0 i/s - 2.40x slower SQLite3 hash: 308646.7 i/s - 2.81x slower SQLite3 data/hash: 288747.1 i/s - 3.01x slower ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic JavaScript Example DESCRIPTION: Sample JavaScript code within a script tag showing DOM manipulation. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/spec/fixtures/md/spec.txt#2025-04-19_snippet_71 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Hard Line Breaks with Spaces in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Example showing how two or more spaces at the end of a line create a hard line break in Markdown. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/spec/fixtures/md/spec.txt#2025-04-19_snippet_334 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` foo baz ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: JavaScript Function Example DESCRIPTION: Sample JavaScript code showing function definition and usage with syntax highlighting SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/script/benchmarks/markdown/most_features.md#2025-04-19_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` var foo = function (bar) { return bar++; }; console.log(foo(5)); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Parameter Binding Performance in SQLite and Extralite DESCRIPTION: Benchmark comparing different parameter binding styles in SQLite and Extralite. Array binding in Extralite is fastest, followed closely by regular binding, while SQLite3 methods are significantly slower overall. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/migrations/scripts/benchmarks/RESULTS.md#2025-04-19_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` Extralite regular 825.159 (± 0.6%) i/s - 8.316k in 10.078450s Extralite named 571.135 (± 0.4%) i/s - 5.742k in 10.053796s Extralite index 769.273 (± 1.0%) i/s - 7.742k in 10.065238s Extralite array 860.549 (± 0.5%) i/s - 8.624k in 10.021749s SQLite3 regular 361.745 (± 0.6%) i/s - 3.636k in 10.051588s SQLite3 named 307.875 (± 0.6%) i/s - 3.090k in 10.036954s Comparison: Extralite array: 860.5 i/s Extralite regular: 825.2 i/s - 1.04x slower Extralite index: 769.3 i/s - 1.12x slower Extralite named: 571.1 i/s - 1.51x slower SQLite3 regular: 361.7 i/s - 2.38x slower SQLite3 named: 307.9 i/s - 2.80x slower ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Illustrating Markdown Document Tree Structure DESCRIPTION: Shows the representation of a Markdown document as a tree structure with open blocks marked by arrows, demonstrating the hierarchical relationship between document elements. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/spec/fixtures/md/spec.txt#2025-04-19_snippet_354 LANGUAGE: tree CODE: ``` -> document -> block_quote paragraph "Lorem ipsum dolor\nsit amet." -> list (type=bullet tight=true bullet_char=-) list_item paragraph "Qui *quodsi iracundia*" -> list_item -> paragraph "aliquando id" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Backslash Escape Sequences DESCRIPTION: Example showing how ASCII punctuation characters can be escaped with backslashes. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/spec/fixtures/md/spec.txt#2025-04-19_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` \!\"\#\$\%\&\'\(\)\*\+\,\-\.\/\:\;\<\=\>\?\@\[\\\]\^\_\`\{\|\}\~ ``` LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```

!"#$%&'()*+,-./:;<=>?@[\]^_`{|}~

``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Output Directory for Export DESCRIPTION: Shell command to create the required output directory for storing exported JSON files from Quandora. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/script/import_scripts/quandora/README.md#2025-04-19_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` mkdir output ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: MailHog SMTP Configuration DESCRIPTION: SMTP server configuration details for MailHog, which runs on localhost port 1025 for SMTP and provides a web interface on port 8025 for viewing captured emails. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/docs/TESTING.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` smtp://127.0.0.1:1025 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Complex Nested Lists with Multiple Types Example in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Shows a complex example of nested lists with ordered and unordered lists at different levels. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/spec/fixtures/md/spec.txt#2025-04-19_snippet_120 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` 1. - 2. foo ``` LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```
      1. foo
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Styleguide URL Path in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Markdown documentation defining the /styleguide URL path that renders widget configurations for styling purposes. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/plugins/styleguide/README.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` # styleguide Adds a URL of `/styleguide` to discourse that renders widgets in various configurations to aid in styling. ![Screenshot](screenshot.png) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Demonstrating List Interrupting Paragraph Example DESCRIPTION: Example showing how a list can interrupt a paragraph in CommonMark without needing a blank line separator. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/spec/fixtures/md/spec.txt#2025-04-19_snippet_128 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` Foo - bar - baz ``` LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```

Foo

  • bar
  • baz
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Markdown List of Supported Video Providers DESCRIPTION: Lists the currently supported and experimental video platform providers that work with the lazy loading functionality. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/plugins/discourse-lazy-videos/README.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ### Supported providers - YouTube - Vimeo ### Experimental - TikTok ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Markdown Emphasis Patterns DESCRIPTION: Common patterns for strong emphasis and nested emphasis in Markdown syntax. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/spec/fixtures/md/spec.txt#2025-04-19_snippet_163 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ***strong emph*** ***strong** in emph* ***emph* in strong** **in strong *emph*** *in emph **strong*** ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Illustrating Fenced Code Block with Tildes in Markdown DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates a fenced code block using tildes instead of backticks. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/spec/fixtures/md/spec.txt#2025-04-19_snippet_65 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ~~~ < > ~~~ ``` LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` 
<
 >
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Quandora Export Script DESCRIPTION: Shell command to run the Ruby export script with the configuration file path as parameter. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/script/import_scripts/quandora/README.md#2025-04-19_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` ruby export.rb /path/to/config.yml ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Block Quote with Code Block DESCRIPTION: Example showing proper indentation for including code blocks within block quotes. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/spec/fixtures/md/spec.txt#2025-04-19_snippet_95 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` > code > not code ``` LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` 
code

not code

``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: List Item Indented Three Spaces Example in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates a list item with three space indentation containing a paragraph, code block, and blockquote. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/spec/fixtures/md/spec.txt#2025-04-19_snippet_109 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` 1. A paragraph with two lines. indented code > A block quote. ``` LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```

  1. A paragraph with two lines.

    indented code

    A block quote.

``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Intraword Markdown Emphasis DESCRIPTION: Examples of internal emphasis using asterisks and underscores within words. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/spec/fixtures/md/spec.txt#2025-04-19_snippet_165 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` internal emphasis: foo*bar*baz no emphasis: foo_bar_baz ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Code Indentation Example DESCRIPTION: Demonstration of indented code block formatting with comments SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/script/benchmarks/markdown/most_features.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` // Some comments line 1 of code line 2 of code line 3 of code ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Links with Fragment Identifiers and Queries DESCRIPTION: Examples showing various forms of links with fragment identifiers and query parameters in their destinations. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/spec/fixtures/md/spec.txt#2025-04-19_snippet_244 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` [link](#fragment) [link](http://example.com#fragment) [link](http://example.com?foo=3#frag) ``` LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```

link

link

link

``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Block Quote Marker in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Simple example of block quote formatting with headers and paragraphs. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/spec/fixtures/md/spec.txt#2025-04-19_snippet_91 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` > # Foo > bar > baz ``` LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```

Foo

bar baz

``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Spoiler Tags in Discourse Posts DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the spoiler tags in a Discourse post to hide sensitive information. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/plugins/spoiler-alert/README.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` I watched the murder mystery on TV last night. [spoiler]The butler did it[/spoiler]. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Multiple Chunks in Indented Code Block DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how an indented code block can contain multiple chunks separated by blank lines. All content, including blank lines, is preserved in the output. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/spec/fixtures/md/spec.txt#2025-04-19_snippet_63 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` chunk1 chunk2 chunk3 ``` LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` 
chunk1

chunk2



chunk3
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Markdown Numbered List with Code Block DESCRIPTION: Example demonstrating standard indentation pattern for code blocks within numbered lists. SOURCE: https://github.com/discourse/discourse/blob/main/spec/fixtures/md/spec.txt#2025-04-19_snippet_125 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` 1. foo indented code ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Quandora Credentials in YAML DESCRIPTION: Sample configuration for Quandora credentials that should be added to config.yml.
